metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15694 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: TigerVNC version prior to 1.10.1 is vulnerable to heap buffer overflow, which could be triggered from DecodeManager::decodeRect. Vulnerability occurs due to the signdness error in processing MemOutStream. Exploitation of this vulnerability could potentially result into remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

criterions.comment: tigervnc package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.1+dfsg-1').
